content: Investments Fundamentals Technical Analysis Stocks Asked by AnonymousAsked on 09 May 2019Is fundamental analysis better than technical analysis? Or do you need both?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Ashley Wong, Financial Assistant at Multi Management & Future SolutionsLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 09 May 2019Both have their own importance. If you are planning to trade for a short term, technical analysis is a more preferred technique. For long term stock trading, fundamental analysis is a way to go.  However, technical analysis can also be a beneficial tool to analyze long-term investments when combined with fundamental analysis. As a trader, it is best to learn both these fundamental and technical analysis skills. 0 comments0
